definition: to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to tell to
dialect/language/speech
where/how
(negative prefix)/not/no
detailed/comprehensive

sentences.english: As usual it gives few details of China’s own weapons.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一样，该文件对中国所持有的武器语焉不详。

sentences.english: Zines today are even more elaborate.
sentences.chinese: 杂志今天更是语焉不详。

definition: to equivocate/to talk evasively (idiom)
to speak evasively (idiom); beating about the bush
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
vague/unclear/ambiguous
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
(idiom) reluctant to speak about it/tight-lipped
equivocal/ambiguous
to not mention a single word (about sth) (idiom)
not to mention (idiom); to say not one word/fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
(confirm to be) true/authentic
to skate around/to skip over/to skimp
(of speech) obscure/unclear/(of actions) vague/ineffectual
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
to refuse to say anything about (idiom)/to remain tight-lipped/to avoid mentioning
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
